verbose_text: XREF_BIBR In particular, U1 snRNPs protect transcripts from premature cleavage and polyadenylation at cryptic polyadenylation signals (PASs) in introns and, when positioned on the first exon, promote transcription.
evidence: snRNPs protect transcripts from premature cleavage and polyadenylation at cryptic polyadenylation signals (PASs) in introns and, when positioned on the first exon, promote transcription
